TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DecimalConverter extends System.ComponentModel.BaseNumberConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a decimal object to and from a string.
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DecimalConverter> class. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
## Examples The following code example converts a variable of type <xref:System.Decimal> to a string, and vice versa.
[!code-cpp[Converters#10](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CPP/converters.cpp#10)] [!code-csharp[Converters#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/CS/converters.cs#10)] [!code-vb[Converters#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Converters/VB/converters.vb#10)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.
